attributes.action: Remove the Leptospirosis Vaccine Requirement for Dog Daycare & Boarding
attributes.additional_details:
Adverse Reactions: Many dogs experience severe side effects from the leptospirosis vaccine, causing distress for pets & owners.
Limited Efficacy: The vaccine’s effectiveness varies, & not all dogs are at risk of exposure to leptospirosis.
Informed Choice: Pet owners should have the right to make healthcare decisions for their pets without mandatory requirements.
Alternative Measures: Improved sanitation & monitoring can effectively reduce the risk of leptospirosis without mandatory vaccination.
attributes.background:
We respectfully request the removal of the mandatory leptospirosis vaccination requirement for dogs in daycare & boarding facilities.
My dog had a bad reaction to the Leptospirosis Vaccine & a large patch of her skin fell off, she now has a permanent bald patch, others have experienced much worse.

rejection.details:
Currently it is not a legal requirement for dog day-care and boarding facilities in the UK to mandate annual leptospirosis vaccinations. 

It is a matter for individual dog day-care and boarding facilities whether they mandate the vaccinations, not the UK Government and Parliament.
